snippet: Joakim Noah told The Chicago Tribune that he has struggled to find his place with the Bulls this season, the first year in a five-year, $60 million contact extension.
abstract: Joakim Noah told The Chicago Tribune that he has struggled to find his place with the Bulls this season, the first year in a five-year, $60 million contact extension.
lead_paragraph: Making the shift from being a promising young player to a big-contract marquee star apparently comes with a lot of pressure for Joakim Noah of the Chicago Bulls. In an interview with The Chicago Tribune, Noah said he has struggled to find his place since signing a five-year, $60 million contact extension in October 2010. The contract kicked in this season.

headline.main: Bulls' Noah Says More Pay Has Affected His Play
